title: Is the use of aluminum sustainable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good grief , Yes. Aluminum, or the raw ore it is refined from Bauxite is IIRC the most plentiful of all metal resources. The planet earth is actually quite large relative to the people on it. Currently it is estimated that we have 55–70 Billion tons of Bauxite. With enough currently in reserve at current consumption trends, is enough for many centuries. Bauxite - Wikipedia

Yes. The bauxite ore used to make aluminum is highly abundant. The only downside is that extracting the aluminum is very energy intensive. Thus, many facilities in the United States use scrap metal instead. Still, the scrap metal business is steady and enables prolific aluminum production.
